question: The sweat glands and piloerector muscles of hairy skin are innervated by which of the following fiber types?
Which of the following is an opioid receptor antagonist used as a drug for opioid overdose and toxicity?
In a T2WI section magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), the cerebrospinal fluid appears as which of the following?

A 55-year-old male presents to the emergency department after a road traffic accident. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) shows damage to the corticospinal tract on one side. Which of the following tract serves as an "alternative pathway" for transmitting motor signals to the spinal cord?

In an experimental lab, multiple stimuli from different neurons are applied to a post-synaptic neuron simultaneously to generate an action potential. Which one of the following phenomena of a synapse is displayed here?

A 32-year-old mother of two children visits a primary healthcare center with complaints of feeling sad, irritable, and empty, and often finds herself crying for no reason for the past three months. She has a loss of interest in all activities and finds it really hard to carry out her daily activities. She feels as if she would be better off dead and even has thoughts about taking her life at times. Which one of the following disorders is she most likely suffering from?

Polio is now endemic in only 2 countries; Pakistan and Afghanistan. Two very effective polio vaccines, the oral and injectable vaccines are being given in the EPI program, and in addition, special immunization campaigns are repeatedly conducted all over Pakistan to eradicate polio. In the routine EPI schedule, which of the following is the correct age for the administration of the injectable polio vaccine (IPV)?
Holoprosencephaly is a malformation characterized by an inability of the cerebral hemispheres to separate at the midline. Which genetic disorder is this malformation associated with?
Which is the correct sequence of components of a reflex arc?

answers.option: Sensory neuron ➜ receptor ➜ association ➜ Sensory neuron ➜ effector
Receptor ➜ sensory neuron ➜ association ➜ motor neuron ➜ effector
Sensory neuron ➜ receptor ➜ association ➜ motor neuron ➜ effector
Sensory neuron ➜ receptor ➜ association ➜ effector ➜ motor neuron
Receptor ➜ sensory neuron ➜ motor neuron ➜ association ➜ effector

question: What is the rate limiting enzyme of dopamine synthesis?
Hemiballismus is caused due to damage to which of the following structures?
Which of the following opioid agonists is used to treat diarrhea?
Which of the following fibers originate in the spinocerebellar tract and terminate on the glomeruli of the cerebellar cortex?

A patient is brought to the emergency department with complaints of headache and dizziness after a head injury. The MRI scan shows a blood clot in the great cerebral vein of Galen. The obstructed vein of the brain is the direct tributary of which of the following venous structures?

A 49-year-old patient is diagnosed with a benign tumor in the orbit which is compressing a structure that runs through the superior orbital fissure. Which of the following nerves would most likely be compressed?

A 62-year-old man has been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease after the neurological examination revealed a resting tremor of the left hand, slow gait, and lack of the normal range of facial expression. Which of the following is the most likely location of the degenerative changes?

The cerebellum is located within the posterior cranial fossa at the back of the brain, immediately inferior to the occipital and temporal lobes. Which of the following is not present if there is a lesion of the cerebellum?
Which of the following arteries is correctly paired with its main stem artery?

answers.option: Posterior inferior cerebellar artery is branch of basilar artery
Pontine arteries are branches of internal carotid artery
Ophthalmic artery is branch of middle cerebral artery
The posterior communicating artery is branch of middle cerebral artery
Posterior spinal artery arise from vertebral artery

question: Which of the following nuclei of the trigeminal nerve is responsible for receiving touch and pressure sensations from the face?
Which of the following statement is appropriate about myelination of brain?

answers.option: The sensory fibers are myelinated last
Myelination is carried out by oligodendrocytes
The process of myelination is carried out by Schwan cells
Myelination of nerve tracts is largely completed by the fourth year of life

question: Which of the following is one of the clinical features of medial medullary syndrome?

answers.option: Sensory deficit affecting trunk of the opposite side
Sensory deficit affecting the face of same side

question: Which of the following nuclei residing in the thalamus receives the ascending sensory tracts through medial and spinal lemnisci?

A patient came with a history of trauma to the frontal lobe due to a road accident, investigation showed trauma to the ventricle as well. Which of the following parts of the ventricular system is more prone to injury in this case?
Constriction of the pupil is the function of the parasympathetic nervous system. Preganglionic parasympathetic fibers arise from which of the following cranial nerve nuclei?

A 55-year-old female on her recovery from a recent stroke experienced difficulty in speech, she can write the words, and understand their meanings, but is unable to produce words. The affected area of the brain producing these symptoms is present in which of the following gyrus of the cerebral cortex?
The age of 5 weeks was estimated in an aborted embryo by counting the elevations on its body. What are the surface elevations on the body of the embryo called?
The adrenal medulla is derived from the fourth germ layer. Which of the following is considered the fourth germ layer?

After being found unconscious a patient was admitted to the hospital. On investigation, there was an infarction involving the medial surface of the cerebral hemisphere. Which of the following areas could be affected in this case?
Concerning the microscopic anatomy of the cerebral cortex, In which of the following layers are the horizontal cells mostly present?
Through which of the following structures the Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) flows from the fourth ventricle in the subarachnoid space?
With respect to the anatomy of the lateral ventricle, which of the following statements is best?

answers.option: Contain choroid plexus responsible for the production of cerebrospinal fluid
Communicate with the third ventricle via foramen megendie
It is present in the cavity of diencephalon
Having posterior horn extending into the temporal lobe of cerebral hemisphere.
Present in in midline between two cerebral hemispheres.

question: During the examination of a histological slide of the cerebellar cortex under a microscope, the student found some flask-shaped cells arranged in a single row in the middle layer of the cerebellar cortex. Which of the following cells was the student observing?

During a road traffic accident, a person had a fracture of the skull. The fracture involved the bones of the anterior cranial fossa. Which one of the following bones could be fractured in the above case?

A 20-year-old female came to the family physician with a complaint of severe back pain. Upon investigation, MRI revealed a tumor arising from cells in the middle layer of the meninges of the spinal cord. In which of the following vertebral levels does the affected layer terminate?

An 8-month-old infant was brought to the pediatrician with a complaint of falling from bed. After examination and investigation diagnosis of increased intracranial pressure was made due involvement of projections of the meninges responsible for the diffusion of the cerebrospinal fluid into the bloodstream. Which of the following are involved projections of meninges?

A 2-year-old boy was infected by poliovirus and suffered flaccid paralysis. By using which one of the following proteins did the virus enter the cell bodies of the neurons in the central nervous system?
Which of the following specialized glial cells are responsible for the maintenance of extracellular potassium homeostasis in the central nervous system?
Which neurotransmitter receptor subtype is primarily responsible for mediating the long-term potentiation (LTP) observed in synaptic plasticity?
Which of the following neurotransmitters is primarily responsible for the regulation of mood and emotional behaviour in the central nervous system?
Which of the following functions is performed by Gi protein coupled metabotropic receptors?
What is the approximate rate of production of Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the adult human brain in 24 hours?
Which of the following factors primarily determines the pressure of cerebrospinal fluid within the intracranial space?

answers.option: Volume of blood in cerebral vessels

question: A patient with an upper motor neuron lesion shows hyperreflexia when a knee-jerk reflex is performed. Which of the following types of reflex arc is involved in this reflex action?
Which of the following touch receptors is known for its exceptional sensitivity to movement and low-frequency vibration?
Which of the following are slowly adapting receptors responsible for detecting light touch, particularly in the fingertips and lips?
On which of the following basis are nerve fibers types A, B, and C primarily classified?
Which of the following nerve fiber types carries post-ganglionic autonomic signals to cardiac muscle, smooth muscle, and glands?
A positive Romberg sign is indicative of damage to which of the following spinal column tract?

A 35-year-old woman sustains a traumatic injury to the T8 level of her spinal cord. She presents with loss of pain and temperature sensation below the level of the injury but preserved touch and proprioceptive sensations. Which of the following pathways is most likely affected?
Which of the following sensations is carried by the anterior spinothalamic tract?
Which of the following pain pathways are associated with poorly localized pain sensation?
Which of the following primary neurotransmitters is decreased by the direct pathway of basal ganglia resulting in increased motor activity?
Which of the following structures is considered the input nucleus of the basal ganglia?
Which of the following pathways of the basal ganglia is associated with the inhibition of unwanted movements?
In Huntington's disease, which of the following neurotransmitters is primarily decreased due to the degeneration of the striatum?
Which of the following types of movements occure due to multiple small lesions in the putamen nucleus that lead to flicking movements in the hands, face, and other parts of the body.
What is the typical function of the cerebellum in motor movement initiation and termination?

answers.option: Turn on agonist and turns off antagonist throughout
Facilitate signals for agonist and antagonist
Turns off agonist and turns on antagonist at termination
Turns on agonist and turns off antagonist at termination
Turns off agonist and turns on antagonist at onset

question: What is the consequence of the absence of cerebellar support in the motor system during movement initiation?

answers.option: Agonist muscle contraction is stronger than normal

question: A 55-year-old woman presents with difficulty swallowing and hoarseness of voice. She also complains of choking while drinking fluids. MRI reveals a tumor involving the medulla oblongata. Which of the following cranial nerves is most likely affected?
According to the gate control theory of pain modulation, which of the following is caused by the stimulation of large-diameter Aẞ fibers?
Which one of the following neurotransmitters has been suggested as a mediator of analgesia produced by stimulation of raphe spinal pathway?

A 45-year-old male was diagnosed to have increased sensitivity to pain without major tissue damage. He complained that even the touch of cloth is painful to him. Which one of the following types of pain is he suffering from?
How does the cerebellum refine muscle contraction timing and precision during learning?

answers.option: Adapting Purkinje cell sensitivity via climbing fibers
Firing climbing fibers once per second

question: A hiker finds herself lost in a desert, with a limited water supply and rising temperatures. She begins to experience an Intense thirst, driving her to search desperately for water sources. Which specific area within the hypothalamus is likely responsible for creating this sensation of thirst in her brain?

A person with damage to a specific region of the hypothalamus experiences a complete lack of satiety during meals, leading to uncontrollable overeating and eventual obesity. Which nuclei within the hypothalamus are most likely to be affected in this Individual?
What occurs to the cerebral cortical response when a sensory stimulus neither elicits reward nor punishment?

answers.option: It becomes habituated, leading to almost complete extinction
It remains constant regardless of repetition
It becomes progressively more intense with repetition
It is reinforced, leading to stronger memory traces

question: The hippocampus serves as an additional channel for incoming sensory signals to initiate behavioral reactions, collaborating with the limbic system through various pathways. Which limbic structures are primarily connected to the hippocampus?

answers.option: Amygdala, hypothalamus, septum, and mammillary bodies

question: Which area of the brain is primarily associated with the production of natural sleep, and its stimulation results in sleep-like characteristics?
Which term describes the phenomenon observed in individuals who have undergone bilateral surgical removal of portions of the hippocampi, rendering them unable to form new memories?

A patient with increased intracranial pressure (ICP) has the following vital signs: blood pressure 99/60, heart rate 65, temperature 101.6 'F, respiration rate 14, and oxygen saturation of 95%. ICP reading is 21 mmHg. Based on these findings, what is the most appropriate initial step in managing this patient?

answers.option: Administer PRN dose of a vasopressor
Remove extra blankets and give the patient a cool bath

question: A patient who experienced a cerebral hemorrhage is at risk for developing increased intracranial pressure (ICP). Which of the following signs and symptoms is the earliest indicator of the patient developing this complication?
Which of the following demographic groups is most commonly affected by Herpes Simplex Virus Type 1 (HSV-1) causing meningitis?
In which of the following population groups does cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection of the nervous system primarily occur, and what are the typical outcomes?

answers.option: Is a common opportunistic viral pathogen in individuals
Primarily in elderly individuals, resulting in peripheral neuropathy and encephalitis
Occurs predominantly in infants and immuno-compromised individuals, leading to microcephaly and periventricular calcification
Mostly seen in adolescents, resulting in cognitive impairment and seizures
Mainly affects pregnant women, leading to fetal periventricular necrosis and brain destruction

question: A 19-year-old college student presents with fever, rash, and neck stiffness. CSF analysis shows increased neutrophils, decreased glucose, and increased protein. Which organism is most likely responsible?
Which of the following patients is at high risk of increased Intracranial pressure?

answers.option: One who is recently been diagnosed as case of multiple sclerosis
One who is recently experienced a myocardial infarction
One who is admitted with a traumatic brain injury
One who is post-op from eye surgery
One who is experiencing severe hypotension

question: A 33-year-old woman with a diffuse macular rash presents with headache, fever, and neck stiffness. CSF analysis reveals lymphocytic pleocytosis, normal glucose, and slightly elevated protein. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 38-year-old HIV-positive man presents with a headache and vision changes. Indian ink staining of the CSF reveals encapsulated yeasts. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old man with a history of chronic otitis media presents with fever, severe headaches, and left-sided weakness. Imaging demonstrates a lentiform-shaped, fluid collection causing midline shift. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 38-year-old female presents with 24 hours of headache, photophobia, mild neck stiffness, and coryzal symptoms. She is fully orientated, and her observations are stable. CSF results show clear fluid with 23 cm H20 pressure. The WBCs are 150 cells /μL (primarily lymphocytes), glucose levels are normal, and protein levels are 90 mg/dL. Which one of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Acetylcholine is a neurotransmitter that enables communication between muscles and nerves. Which of the following is a condition caused by an interruption in the interaction between acetylcholine and acetylcholine receptor sites on the muscles?

A 55-year-old female presents to the emergency department with bilateral foot pain, which she describes as a burning pain. She also has mild numbness in both feet, especially her toes. She admits to drinking about 12 glasses of beer a day. Her vitals are within the normal range. Upon physical examination, both of her feet demonstrate diminished sensation to pinprick. A primary cause of this patient's condition is a deficiency of which of the following vitamins?
Which of the following is the function of vitamin B6?

answers.option: Acts as a coenzyme in alpha-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase enzyme
Acts as a coenzyme in carbon-dioxide fixation reactions
Acts as a coenzyme in transketolase enzyme
Acts as a coenzyme in pyruvate dehydrogenase complex
Acts as a coenzyme in decarboxylation reactions

question: Which of the following vitamins is required for the synthesis of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine?

Catecholamines are a class of neurotransmitters that play essential roles in various physiological processes. They include dopamine, norepinephrine, and epinephrine. These molecules are derived from the amino acid tyrosine. Which of the following is the rate-limiting step in the biosynthetic pathway of catecholamines?

At the interface between blood and brain, endothelial cells are tightly packed together with the help of tight junctions that are specialized transmembrane proteins. Which of the following are those specialized transmembrane proteins?

This transmitter is mostly located in diffuse neuronal systems in the CNS, with cell bodies, particularly in the raphe nuclei. It appears to play a major role in the expression of mood states, and many antidepressant drugs are thought to increase its functional activity.
A decrease in K+ conductance is associated with neuronal excitation. Which of the following neurotransmitters does not follow this mechanism (decrease in K+ conductance)?

Infection by which of the following organisms causes the formation of a grayish membrane over the tonsils, pharynx, or larynx, with well-defined edges and bleeding of the surface due to the membrane's removal?
Poliomyelitis mainly affects children under 5 years of age and may lead to irreversible paralysis. Which human body system is primarily Infected by the polio virus?

A 14-year-old boy, while coming back from school, was bitten by a stray dog without any provocation. There was some bleeding from wounds. He was taken to a nearby hospital. What is the first step which should be done immediately?

answers.option: Give Rabies Vaccine and Rabies immunoglobulin
Wash the wound with water and soap for 10-15 minutes

question: A 42-year-old male visits a primary healthcare center with complaints of feeling sad, irritable, empty, and crying often for three months. He has lost interest in activities and finds it very difficult to carry out daily activities. He feels he is better off dead. Which one of the following is the most likely mental disorder that he is suffering from?
A snake bite victim exhibiting the signs of ptosis, diplopia, dysphagia, and respiratory failure is affected by which of the following types of snake venom?
A surgeon performs a risky procedure on a patient without their informed consent, believing it to be in the patient's best interest. Which of the following ethical principles is violated?

Alex is frustrated with his colleague, Emily, for constantly interrupting him during team meetings. He finds it challenging to express his concerns without coming across as confrontational. Which aspect of emotional intelligence is Alex in most need of to handle this situation effectively?

A 25-year-old woman, Emily, has recently experienced a traumatic event resulting in acute distress and emotional upheaval. She is struggling to cope with the overwhelming emotions and is displaying signs of anxiety and agitation. According to the ACT Model, what is the primary focus during the assessment phase of crisis Intervention?

answers.option: Identifying the root cause of Emily's trauma
Establishing a therapeutic alliance and rapport

question: A 32-year-old male was brought to the Emergency department with a history of loss of consciousness after a road traffic accident. What will be the first radiologic investigation of choice?

A 54-year-old male presented to the Outpatient department with a backache radiating to the right lower limb for four weeks. There is no history of trauma or fever. His x-ray lumbar spine done two weeks earlier, was unremarkable. Which of the following radiological investigations will show spinal nerve compression?
Which of the following structures is involved in forming the lateral wall of the third ventricle?
If a person is not able to stand with an upright posture, which tract is most likely affected in this case?
Which structure forms the superior part of the roof of the fourth ventricle?
Which of the following shows a compensatory increase in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) volume due to brain tissue loss?
Saccular aneurysms are the most frequently occurring type of intracranial aneurysm. What percentage of these occur in the anterior circulation?

A 25-year-old man presents to the outpatient department after falling from a ladder. The MRI reveals a skull fracture with a hematoma which is compressing the brain. The dura appears to be peeling off of the skull. Which type of hemorrhage is occurring?
